data.title: “I don’t know a member of Congress whose e-mails and phone calls are in favor of this” --- Phone calls to Congress show Americans are "almost unanimously" united in opposition to military force in Syria.
Japanese professor pushes for Hide and Seek at the Olympics
Tony Abbott will be Australian prime minister after decisive election victory
Chinese President Xi Jinping told his U.S. counterpart Barack Obama on Friday that the crisis in Syria should not be resolved through a military strike and urged him to consider a political solution

What began as small talk after Putin approached Obama led to the two pulling up chairs in the corner of the room and talking almost entirely about Syria for 20 to 30 minutes, as other leaders watched...Both leaders said they could work together to seek a political solution to the Syrian crisis.
London Student Reported to the Police: for "mentioning the ideologies of anarchism and individualism on his blog"
Kenya urges world to impose moratorium on ivory trading to save wildlife

Christian televangelist Pat Robertson is threatening legal action against a Canadian documentary team over their film alleging that Robertson used a bogus charity as a supply line for his diamond mining business in Africa.
